title: Show unique hash during spack concretize
body:
I would like to see unique hash during spack concretize, this should show all packages installed, whereas current `spack concretize` will show duplicate hash for package if it's a dependency in other partial dags. 

### Rationale

It is hard to pinpoint a package is built once or multiple times, i have several package section with `buildable: false` it is hard to analyze `spack concretize` to see all the package hash

### Description

The command could be `spack concretize --uniquehash` which shows output of concretized specs with a single entry per unique hash. The output would be similar except we skip packages that have duplicate hash during spack concretize output. There could be a short option `spack concretize -u`. The output doesn't have to show tab-indented depdenencies with `^` the idea would be to print all specs with hash and package build configuration. The unique hash helps end-user find how many packages are going to get installed, it could be nice at end to show total number of packages installed. If its possible to count external packages that would be nice, this gives user a count of package install as they change their spack.yaml.

I am trying to optimize my builds by avoid building multiple packages and if system package is provided I use that instead.

### Addition Description

This is the concretized spec of my environment, what i would like is to avoid multiple printing multiple packages with same hash in this case `autoconf`, `automake`, `bzip2`, should have same hash. I have many packages in my `packages` section in spack.yaml that i need to analyze to see if they are buillt once vs built several times. For example i can see multiple version of boost installed with different hashes which is fine since it got picked up with two different variants (**cxxstd=14** and **cxxstd=98**)
